PAS.content: she slips into the water when she is abandoned by ses pas
water: a movement w/out pas, beyond all tension (crispation) of pas, degree zero of an infinite metaphor [see p. (84) sans as degree o]

eau, element where she no longer can find a foothold, also element of “sovereign time,” illusion du sans-pas, of the absence of space, when ses pas have left her, her movement is always entry, penetration [see HYMEN]
water as cruel illusion of “sovereign time,” illusion of sans pas
name, thing, element of name or thing, syllable or letter determines eau as sea, tide, with rhythms and edges (bordures), shores or wrecks (rivages ou naufrages)
neither word nor syllable eau, o, could signify affection by which what departs from come relates to itself from the other: there was no water
waters (parages), where every machine is stopped
le surgissement, calling someone to his own proper name in water > analyze baptism from this gift of the name
Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves, and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens
eau is a rebus, a morsel (morceau) or moment of a word (thing, letter, names, syllable, cry) > like sans, pas, sauf, rat, not a theme, sense, signifier
the immense always brings us back to the water

in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)
o as degree 0 (of appearance), double 0 as “power of 0 and 2” > the pas de Sans-Nom, EROS, neither gathers, identifies, nor excludes the one or the other
name is no more its infinitely divisible elements than it is dispersed in them like foam in anonymous sea [Kant’s simple/composite]

PPHS.content: Hegel [Science of Logic]: sign, more precisely Sprache, fulfills spiritual function of middle (like water in nature)

Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > permits passage to conceptuality

RM.content: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]

BSi.content: [re: D.H. Lawerence’s poem “Snake”] scene of hospitality at water source

OG.content: Rousseau: cradle of nations, first fires of love born at water wells; p. 267 “well of oath” in Genesis XXI

neume, epoch of natural languages: fête autour du point d’eau, temps de l’Isle de Saint-Pierre [?]: l’image fixant ce qui ne fut qu’un point de pur passage—la limite toujours déjà franchie, rèpere absolu
